revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-07 21:46:46.000000000', 'message': 'Switch Solum service to cycle-with-rc

There were several deliverables set as cycle-with-intermediary that have
not been doing intermediary releases. That release model is intended for
deliverables that will be releases multiple times throughout the
development cycle.

With the newer cycle-with-rc release model, teams have the option of not
requiring releases during the cycle and just making sure they are done
near the end of the cycle. See [1] for more details.

This proposes to change the cycle-with-intermediary deliverable to be
cycle-with-rc. Please confirm this is acceptable for the team and feel
free to ask any questions about this change.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2018-December/000465.html

Change-Id: If5b7c30fcda8deb2056888d9c2470c8702bf4f03
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Switch Solum service to cycle-with-rc

There were several deliverables set as cycle-with-intermediary that have
not been doing intermediary releases. That release model is intended for
deliverables that will be releases multiple times throughout the
development cycle.

With the newer cycle-with-rc release model, teams have the option of not
requiring releases during the cycle and just making sure they are done
near the end of the cycle. See [1] for more details.

This proposes to change the cycle-with-intermediary deliverable to be
cycle-with-rc. Please confirm this is acceptable for the team and feel
free to ask any questions about this change.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2018-December/000465.html

Change-Id: If5b7c30fcda8deb2056888d9c2470c8702bf4f03
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Remove nonexistent job from gate

This is a follow-up to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/635321/
which removed a job configuration but missed removing the
reference to that job in the gate config.

Change-Id: If81145a743cec4070281b9f1369f101d4008e373

commit_message:
Use tox 3.1.1 fixes

By 3.1.1, tox had fixed:
- [1] which mishandled the basepython directive.
- ignoring PYTHONDONTWRITEBYTECODE [2]

Require this version and remove the workarounds.

See ML thread [3] for some details

[1] https://github.com/tox-dev/tox/issues/477
[2] https://github.com/tox-dev/tox/commit/336f4f6bd8b53223f940fc5cfc43b1bbd78d4699
[3] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-July/thread.html#132075

Change-Id: Iff442451c7a95caa7b9d22c76c341150175a34d1

commit_message:
Notify not only cinder service, but also Apache

Apache needs to be notified as well in case the API is being served in
that context, otherwise config changes would not take effect without
manual intervention.

Change-Id: If5e7c14d59843ee7c813eb1df8d7131e002dbd22
(cherry picked from commit 2cd58b8fb0799d2c00a35545daa0eaae2a5b2bc5)

subject: Set database isolation level in perfload
messages:
[{'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2019-02-05 06:36:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2019-02-05 09:05:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

Just an idea. Zuul log says this is okay this time, but I'd like to see the reproducibility more."}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-02-05 11:15:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

This might be a reasonable thing to do, but now that the perfload is being timed as well, it might make sense to still do the heating, so that whatever either the placement code or the database itself is doing to resolve the race during those initial creations doesn't impact the timing.

Actually, it's probably negligible, so the above comments can probably be ignored."}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2019-02-06 00:41:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> so that whatever either the placement code or the database itself is doing to resolve the race during those initial creations doesn't impact the timing.

Ah, I missed the point. Assuming that this high currency is minor cases in the real world, yes, that's more reasonable and good spot."}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2019-02-14 02:49:09.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-05 06:36:26.000000000', 'message': 'Set database isolation level in perfload

To avoid aggregate conflict on creation, perfload.yaml preheated the
aggregates creating 10 resource providers so that _ensure_aggregate
doesn't try to loop to seek them in the main execution for performance
measurements dealing 1000 resource providers.

However, this execution is not related with the main purpose of
the performance measurement.

To simplify the log output, this patch provides an alternative way to
avoid the conflict. It sets DB default isolation level to
"READ COMMITED" in advance, and enable _ensure_aggregate in the second
loop to find the aggreate id, which is just created(committed) by
another thread.

Note that "READ COMMITED" is the default behavior of PostgreSQL and
SQLite while the default of MySQL is "REPEATABLE READ" where the
_ensure_aggregate finds no aggregate id repeatably in one transaction.

Change-Id: I192258d1554ba8d18e6f7f263b74c1470e5e70d3
Related-Bug: #1804453
'}]
commit_message:
Set database isolation level in perfload

To avoid aggregate conflict on creation, perfload.yaml preheated the
aggregates creating 10 resource providers so that _ensure_aggregate
doesn't try to loop to seek them in the main execution for performance
measurements dealing 1000 resource providers.

However, this execution is not related with the main purpose of
the performance measurement.

To simplify the log output, this patch provides an alternative way to
avoid the conflict. It sets DB default isolation level to
"READ COMMITED" in advance, and enable _ensure_aggregate in the second
loop to find the aggreate id, which is just created(committed) by
another thread.

Note that "READ COMMITED" is the default behavior of PostgreSQL and
SQLite while the default of MySQL is "REPEATABLE READ" where the
_ensure_aggregate finds no aggregate id repeatably in one transaction.

Change-Id: I192258d1554ba8d18e6f7f263b74c1470e5e70d3
Related-Bug: #1804453

subject: Remove get_chksum to hush warnings
messages:
[{'account_id': 597, 'date': '2019-02-13 06:48:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-02-14 01:24:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-02-14 01:48:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

(1 comment)'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-13 06:48:01.000000000', 'message': 'Remove get_chksum to hush warnings

This popped up because Fedora mandates warning-free builds,
and get_chksum triggers a warning because it returns an
unaligned pointer (it is so analigned, static analysis in
the compiler can detect it).

The easiest fix is to remove it altogether. We think it should
be safe, because:

 - The function is not listed in any headers
 - Its counterpart is called "set_checksum", not "set_chksum"
 - PyECLib does not use it

We also hush some doxygen warnings about wrong comments.

Change-Id: Ie5bc736f912706e0ffd507765abd24e7f4761233
'}]
commit_message:
Remove get_chksum to hush warnings

This popped up because Fedora mandates warning-free builds,
and get_chksum triggers a warning because it returns an
unaligned pointer (it is so analigned, static analysis in
the compiler can detect it).

The easiest fix is to remove it altogether. We think it should
be safe, because:

 - The function is not listed in any headers
 - Its counterpart is called "set_checksum", not "set_chksum"
 - PyECLib does not use it

We also hush some doxygen warnings about wrong comments.

Change-Id: Ie5bc736f912706e0ffd507765abd24e7f4761233

commit_message:
ppc64le: fix package list gathering

The task was referencing 'ansible_architecture' as a literal string
instead of using the value of the variable as a key to the alt
arch map

Change-Id: I52cef7abd6a9af71fcd4d134e289879a736d33b6
Closes-Bug: #1815659
(cherry picked from commit 5e78067f409a438411c5c563811ac6edba358229)

commit_message:
Fix stable/rocky gate issues

When setting this to the 13.0.0b2 beta version
the logic that pulls in the correct versions for
stable branches breaks. This changes to use the
first stable release as the minimal requirement
which unblocks the CI.

This change also addresses an issue where toxenv
fails on deleting a non-empty __pycache__
directory. This fixes the find command syntax to
be more tolerant of this scenario.

Change-Id: Ifbad29674a3d47aa0185e27f51e8d83a45ec6d56

commit_message:
Add cloudkitty::storage_version

This adds the storage/version configuration option
that can be used in combination with storage_backend
to select the backend and version to use.

Also fixes acceptance testing so that the testing
actually passes without us needing to set it to nv.

Change-Id: I7a17889b60c4e72e559ace248f24ccfd53db809a

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-13 00:29:26.000000000', 'message': "DVR: External pm for keepalived destroyed on SNAT namespace delete

External process monitor for keepalived state change should
be destroyed when the External Gateway is removed for DVR HA
routers.
We have seen under certain conditions when the SNAT namespace
is missing, the External process Monitor is trying to respawn
the keepalived state change monitor process within the
namespace that does not exist and keeps filling in the logs.

The fix is to destroy the keepalived state change monitor
when the namespace is deleted.

Closes-Bug: #1815676

The 'delete' ha-router takes care of cleaning the external process monitor subscription for the keepalived state change, but the external gateway remove function is not calling this function.

Change-Id: I03711cc80a61dec999b733f7ed54a615a72da13e
"}, {'created': '2019-02-13 18:21:34.000000000', 'message': 'DVR: External pm for keepalived destroyed on SNAT namespace delete

External process monitor for keepalived state change should
be destroyed when the External Gateway is removed for DVR HA
routers.
We have seen under certain conditions when the SNAT namespace
is missing, the External process Monitor is trying to respawn
the keepalived state change monitor process within the
namespace that does not exist and keeps filling in the logs.

The fix is to destroy the keepalived state change monitor
when the namespace is deleted.

Closes-Bug: #1815676

Change-Id: I03711cc80a61dec999b733f7ed54a615a72da13e
'}]
commit_message:
DVR: External pm for keepalived destroyed on SNAT namespace delete

External process monitor for keepalived state change should
be destroyed when the External Gateway is removed for DVR HA
routers.
We have seen under certain conditions when the SNAT namespace
is missing, the External process Monitor is trying to respawn
the keepalived state change monitor process within the
namespace that does not exist and keeps filling in the logs.

The fix is to destroy the keepalived state change monitor
when the namespace is deleted.

Closes-Bug: #1815676

Change-Id: I03711cc80a61dec999b733f7ed54a615a72da13e

commit_message:
Extra variables to reprovision pacemaker cluster one node at a time.

For the upgrade we have to re-provision the controller cluster, one
node at a time.

Using extra override variable set in hiera we are able to specify to
pacemaker which nodes should be added to the cluster.

Change-Id: I2f6ef4679265718fbbe8726ee6c81832bc468f3e
Implements: blueprint upgrades-with-os

The ObjectVersionChecker fixture is logging object
comparison at INFO which in some tests can blow up
the subunit output stream capture parser (see nova
bug 1813147). This change drops the logging level
to DEBUG which can be enabled using the OS_DEBUG
environment variable found in oslotest.

Closes-Bug: #1815223
'}]
commit_message:
Lower ObjectVersionChecker logging to DEBUG level

The ObjectVersionChecker fixture is logging object
comparison at INFO which in some tests can blow up
the subunit output stream capture parser (see nova
bug 1813147). This change drops the logging level
to DEBUG which can be enabled using the OS_DEBUG
environment variable found in oslotest.

Change-Id: If20663ecad19f18f22172ae489206b42489fd9f6
Closes-Bug: #1815223

commit_message:
Improves ceph-provisioner storageclasses

Currently configuring storage classes is static. If
we want to add another storageclass for an exmaple
for harddisk then we have to create another yaml
along with update in .Values.yaml. Using this change
we can create as many storageclasses we want. Change
will basically iterate in loop and apply the values
present in .Values

Change-Id: Id63a9553da246b7d909fd2fd96a309b02156e3fe
Story: ceph-provisioners-improvement
Signed-off-by: Kranthi Guttikonda <kranthi.guttikonda@b-yond.com>
Signed-off-by: kranthikirang <kranthi.guttikonda@b-yond.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-13 06:45:30.000000000', 'message': 'Make our alt crc32 more portable

Apparently the author of our old crc32 assumed that shifting an int
to the right sign-extends, which is not always the case. Result is,
building and running make test on s390x fails. The fix is to force
a sign-extension using the "xor 0x80; sub 0x80" trick.

N.B. This does not cause a compatibility problem, because by a
miracle the "broken" crc32_alt was actually computing a stock
crc32, same that zlib has. Therefore, if someone, somewhere,
ran a Swift cluster on s390x with erasure coding policy,
the data in it is already stored with zlib checksums, as we
do it now anyway. This fix only permits the tests pass, which
used the bad data sample from x86.

Change-Id: Ibd5e4e6c02be00540a9648cc7e0f8efda275bf3f
'}, {'created': '2019-02-13 21:25:35.000000000', 'message': 'Make our alt crc32 more portable

Apparently the author of our old crc32 assumed that shifting an int
to the right sign-extends, which is not always the case. Result is,
building and running make test on s390x fails. The fix is to force
a sign-extension using the "xor 0x80; sub 0x80" trick.

N.B. This does not cause a compatibility problem, because by a
miracle the "broken" crc32_alt was actually computing a stock
crc32, same that zlib has. Therefore, if someone, somewhere,
ran a Swift cluster on s390x with erasure coding policy,
the data in it is already stored with zlib checksums, as we
do it now anyway. This fix only permits the tests pass, which
used the bad data sample from x86.

Change-Id: Ibd5e4e6c02be00540a9648cc7e0f8efda275bf3f
Related-Change: Ib5ea2a830c7c23d66bf2ca404a3eb84ad00c5bc5
Related-Bug: 1666320
'}]
commit_message:
Make our alt crc32 more portable

Apparently the author of our old crc32 assumed that shifting an int
to the right sign-extends, which is not always the case. Result is,
building and running make test on s390x fails. The fix is to force
a sign-extension using the "xor 0x80; sub 0x80" trick.

N.B. This does not cause a compatibility problem, because by a
miracle the "broken" crc32_alt was actually computing a stock
crc32, same that zlib has. Therefore, if someone, somewhere,
ran a Swift cluster on s390x with erasure coding policy,
the data in it is already stored with zlib checksums, as we
do it now anyway. This fix only permits the tests pass, which
used the bad data sample from x86.

Change-Id: Ibd5e4e6c02be00540a9648cc7e0f8efda275bf3f
Related-Change: Ib5ea2a830c7c23d66bf2ca404a3eb84ad00c5bc5
Related-Bug: 1666320

Doing this in this playbook would result in the environment having packages installed, but no source repo for them - and would probably causes issues when trying to install new packages as part of the subsequent install.

The correct place to do this would be in https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible-openstack_hosts which is the role that implements the new UCA config. The data structure in the ubuntu vars files allow for an entry to be both added (state: present) or removed (state: absent).'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2019-02-13 21:17:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Using that would mean that the old UCA config would only be removed once the new one is added.'}, {'account_id': 21314, 'date': '2019-02-13 21:36:46.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

wrong place to do this'}]

commit_message:
Make old UCA repo not active during upgrade

We want to ensure that the previous UCA repos are not used during
upgrades.

Change-Id: I627f705a60d6dcd2d9304c7ce28a1c92a0c12821
Closes-bug: 1747755

commit_message:
ppc64le: fix package list gathering

The task was referencing 'ansible_architecture' as a literal string
instead of using the value of the variable as a key to the alt
arch map

Change-Id: I52cef7abd6a9af71fcd4d134e289879a736d33b6
Closes-Bug: #1815659

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-13 01:21:10.000000000', 'message': "move the email deadline for the train election out a few days

We would like to have the new placement team included in the regular PTL
elections for Train to avoid having to run a special election. To do
that, we'll need to shift the deadline out a little to give the TC time
to approve the new team, as requested in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/636416/

Change-Id: I3cd7882e79c138a3327e97c40da6383beecb9b2f
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
"}]
commit_message:
move the email deadline for the train election out a few days

We would like to have the new placement team included in the regular PTL
elections for Train to avoid having to run a special election. To do
that, we'll need to shift the deadline out a little to give the TC time
to approve the new team, as requested in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/636416/

Change-Id: I3cd7882e79c138a3327e97c40da6383beecb9b2f
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario007-multinode-oooq-container fs30 needs to pass'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2018-10-19 13:26:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

It can't pass Wes: I'm trying to flip scenario007 to run against ML2/OVS so I need to depend on a THT patch that changes this scenario. But the THT patch won't pass CI without the fs30 changes so I think only way would be merging this while scenario007 job is non-voting.
Thoughts?"}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2018-10-24 07:56:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2018-10-26 05:06:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2018-10-26 05:09:05.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from 611653 to ovn_testing'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2018-10-26 05:09:25.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from ovn_testing to ovn-testing'}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2018-12-12 11:30:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

Thanks Gabriele, now https://review.openstack.org/#/c/593056 is in a good shape and accepting reviews. We still need scenario07 to be non-voting here or we would have to make both patches depend on each other.
I think we can remove the -W, what do you think?'}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2019-02-01 20:47:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2019-02-01 20:48:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

does this really depend on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/593056/ ?'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2019-02-01 21:38:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

We need to merge this while non voting and merge the other depending on this one.'}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2019-02-08 09:33:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-02-13 16:40:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Change featureset030 to work with ML2/OVS

By switching the default mechanism driver in TripleO
from 'openvswitch' to 'ovn', we will be flipping all
the scenario jobs to run with ML2/OVN as the network
backend.

In order to maintain ML2/OVS coverage, the scenario 7
job (which ran previously with ML2/OVN) is now flipped
to run with ML2/OVS.

Change-Id: I74ffb6b7f912e1fce6ce428cd23a7283c91b8b96
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Role to install apache to serve container images

Since podman doesn't yet support mirrors, this service needs to be run
on the host instead of in a container, because there is no reliable
way to get the image onto the undercloud.

Blueprint: podman-support
Change-Id: I5c4920ffbd70171baa4d8ba3ace70b11358aa506

commit_message:
Handle uncompressed layers on image export

There is currently a bug in buildah which results in it committing
uncompressed layers, which has exposed an issue with the exporter that
assumes all layers in containers-storage are compressed.

This change handles exporting an uncompressed layer, and also fixes an
issue where the calc_digest was sometimes corrupted by adding the data
twice.

Change-Id: I25ccac3672ec64481a20bf68f3ffc61fcda7a389
Blueprint: podman-support

[{'created': '2019-02-07 07:46:07.000000000', 'message': 'Fix wrong example for direct_maps

Direct_maps is a list which we can see from [1].
This list is being appended to another list in [2].
This patch fixes the example of direct_maps passed
to the function _update_local_mapping.

[1]https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/6dd1c7dae82b55d9d7126da7f4356eac2cc494c1/keystone/federation/utils.py#L819
[2]https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/6dd1c7dae82b55d9d7126da7f4356eac2cc494c1/keystone/federation/utils.py#L250

Change-Id: I82190d421989638ca6c1c6b6a61de871662b2c06

Direct_maps is a list in federation/utils.py.
This list is being appended to another list in
Class DirectMaps in federaton/utils.py.

This patch fixes the example of direct_maps passed
to the function _update_local_mapping.

Change-Id: I82190d421989638ca6c1c6b6a61de871662b2c06

commit_message:
Fix wrong example for direct_maps

Direct_maps is a list in federation/utils.py.
This list is being appended to another list in
Class DirectMaps in federaton/utils.py.

This patch fixes the example of direct_maps passed
to the function _update_local_mapping.

commit_message:
Add Cluster Healing specification

Add a new spec covering required changes, their impact and
implementation details for new functionality dealing with the healing of
Magnum clusters.

Implements: blueprint cluster-healing

commit_message:
Prepare one zuul docker job for all services

We want to have one flow for building Docker images of all Monasca
components. Every component should have `docker` folder and in this
folder file with name `build_image.sh` should be placed. By having one
global Zuul we could force this convention. Also this is good for
avoiding code duplication. Remove timeouts. They was unnecessary big.

Story: 2001694
Task: 28994
Change-Id: Iee7de1d8e873817a3b6f72e7ecc815bd8d6eb705

I'm fine with it. Let's wait for boden to +1 it as well"}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2019-02-13 08:31:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-02-13 15:41:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

PTL approval ok.

I might be wrong (so please correct me), but 461be560769f4c591cd6a6513a873fcef92c0789 has introduced a commit which changes the API, including its documentation.

If it's backwards incompatible, shouldn't the major version be updated here? I think the shim introduced in that commit could allow a minor version only change, but the documentation is also showing otherwise. I am on the fence here, so I am waiting for someone to tell me I am wrong :p"}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-02-13 16:44:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

As neutron release liaison, this release looks good including the minor version bump (See below in detail).

> I might be wrong (so please correct me), but 461be560769f4c591cd6a6513a873fcef92c0789 has introduced a commit which changes the API, including its documentation.
> 
> If it's backwards incompatible, shouldn't the major version be updated here? I think the shim introduced in that commit could allow a minor version only change, but the documentation is also showing otherwise. I am on the fence here, so I am waiting for someone to tell me I am wrong :p

"API" in this context is a new feature support in the networking REST API in the neutron deliverables (in this case the neutron repo).
This is not an API change in the library interface in neutron-lib.
Thus, this commit is backward compatible.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-02-13 16:49:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-02-13 16:49:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Release os-traits 0.11.0

I'd like to propose what is effectively a Stein milestone-2 release
for os-traits to release merged commits since the last release.

Among other things this would make available some new traits for
virtual TPM and AMD secure virtualization.

Note that +1 from the PTL or release liason is needed, I am not either.

Change-Id: I9c2110a6c3cf90aac4976c07e994edae2a0aba0a

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-07 21:44:48.000000000', 'message': 'Switch Magnum service to cycle-with-rc

There were several deliverables set as cycle-with-intermediary that have
not been doing intermediary releases. That release model is intended for
deliverables that will be releases multiple times throughout the
development cycle.

With the newer cycle-with-rc release model, teams have the option of not
requiring releases during the cycle and just making sure they are done
near the end of the cycle. See [1] for more details.

This proposes to change this cycle-with-intermediary deliverable to be
cycle-with-rc. Please confirm this is acceptable for the team and feel
free to ask any questions about this change.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2018-December/000465.html

Change-Id: Iee8d9dfc34b3a3e9cbbd8ca749a538172aa1bb2a
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Switch Magnum service to cycle-with-rc

There were several deliverables set as cycle-with-intermediary that have
not been doing intermediary releases. That release model is intended for
deliverables that will be releases multiple times throughout the
development cycle.

With the newer cycle-with-rc release model, teams have the option of not
requiring releases during the cycle and just making sure they are done
near the end of the cycle. See [1] for more details.

This proposes to change this cycle-with-intermediary deliverable to be
cycle-with-rc. Please confirm this is acceptable for the team and feel
free to ask any questions about this change.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2018-December/000465.html

Change-Id: Iee8d9dfc34b3a3e9cbbd8ca749a538172aa1bb2a
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

With the newer cycle-with-rc release model, teams have the option of not
requiring releases during the cycle and just making sure they are done
near the end of the cycle. See [1] for more details.

This proposes to change the cycle-with-intermediary deliverable to be
cycle-with-rc. Please confirm this is acceptable for the team and feel
free to ask any questions about this change.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2018-December/000465.html

Change-Id: I502cab150ebb1543affe89eb0ad84dbadabd92cb
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Switch Zun service to cycle-with-rc

There were several deliverables set as cycle-with-intermediary that have
not been doing intermediary releases. That release model is intended for
deliverables that will be releases multiple times throughout the
development cycle.

With the newer cycle-with-rc release model, teams have the option of not
requiring releases during the cycle and just making sure they are done
near the end of the cycle. See [1] for more details.

This proposes to change the cycle-with-intermediary deliverable to be
cycle-with-rc. Please confirm this is acceptable for the team and feel
free to ask any questions about this change.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2018-December/000465.html

Change-Id: I502cab150ebb1543affe89eb0ad84dbadabd92cb
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
python-novaclient: release stein 12.0.0

This release contains bug fixes and:
  - removes the deprecated 'novaclient.v2.contrib' modules
  - removes the 'only_contrib' keyword argument for the
    'novaclient.client.discover_extensions' method
  - deprecates the '--instance-name' option from the 'nova list'
    command

Change-Id: I815b4d4c5d5a8862e4141be21022c0756f67fdb5

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-07 09:44:45.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure dnsmasq is down before enabling it in restart method

Dnsmasq driver used by dhcp agent has restart() method which is
calling disable() and then enable() dnsmasq process again.
What can be observed in functional tests from time to time it may
happen that start dnsmasq process will be called before old process
is really down. That leads to error that IP address to which
dnsmasq wants to bind is already in use and it fails to start.

This patch adds possibility to call disable() method with block flag
set to True. In such case driver will ensure in disable() method that
process is really not active.
This blocking disable() is used in restart() method now.

Change-Id: I419a451633badbc3d32edcee1945fca3e3d9f6be
Closes-Bug: #1811126
(cherry picked from commit d471a85931d6f6495efdb8ff43bf903e3e1d639d)
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure dnsmasq is down before enabling it in restart method

Dnsmasq driver used by dhcp agent has restart() method which is
calling disable() and then enable() dnsmasq process again.
What can be observed in functional tests from time to time it may
happen that start dnsmasq process will be called before old process
is really down. That leads to error that IP address to which
dnsmasq wants to bind is already in use and it fails to start.

This patch adds possibility to call disable() method with block flag
set to True. In such case driver will ensure in disable() method that
process is really not active.
This blocking disable() is used in restart() method now.

Change-Id: I419a451633badbc3d32edcee1945fca3e3d9f6be
Closes-Bug: #1811126
(cherry picked from commit d471a85931d6f6495efdb8ff43bf903e3e1d639d)

Change nova-next job to run with python3

The way of the future is python 3 so it makes sense
that our nova-next job, which is meant to test future
things and advanced configuration, would run under python3.

Change-Id: Ie33efb41de19837b488d175900d9a4666f073bce

commit_message:
Delete virtual interface "ovs-system" before load openvswitch module

When openvswitch module is loaded by modprobe in [1], if  virtual
interface "ovs-system" exists, it causes the error " modprobe:
FATAL: Module openvswitch is in use."

This patch will check "ovs-system" exists or not, then delete it
before load openvswitch module.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/devstack/lib/ovs#L92

Change-Id: I750bd74d1d07a73b57924b84f3d8506e6063936c

commit_message:
Introspection data storage backend follow up

An issue is spotted during implementing [1], we have a solely code
path from api, do_reapply, reapply, to _reapply. Inspector now reads
intrspection data ahead, so there is no need to do so in _reapply,
reading introspection data there is never reached.

The patch removes unecessary code and corresponding tests.

[1] https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/1564863

Change-Id: I5558bce2bc49de3d1c5dba59e203de4824a3addd
Story: 1726713
Task: 11373

commit_message:
api-ref: volume_type_access should be array instead of object

https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/block-storage/v3/index.html#list-private-volume-type-access-detail

volume_type_access in the response of "List private volume type access detail"
should be array, instead of object.

NOTE: the response sample file will be auto-generated in Iad7932337647274dbbbc35045b4febbbc8d9d36d

Change-Id: I1a02f3b7791f6c44d8e50949f28dc6a112429662

commit_message:
Index "error" non capital sensitive to logstash

We are facing intermitent issues that we want to monitor at logstash,
those issues are not starting with a "20.." date they are like [1] so
let's add lines with "error" to logstash.

[1] {"errors":[{"code":"MANIFEST_BLOB_UNKNOWN","message":"blob unknown to ...

Change-Id: I02bd38571279ccc186b3a61acee218e5246e86e3

[{'created': '2019-02-13 17:32:24.000000000', 'message': 'Reject all_tenants filter for non-admin users

all_tenants filter is allowed for admin users only,
it is currently being rejected at the client side.
This patch handles the filter on the server side.

Change-Id: Idfc4ff39ceed14842878d5b4b874bb9b1c0fc4f3
'}]
commit_message:
Reject all_tenants filter for non-admin users

all_tenants filter is allowed for admin users only,
it is currently being rejected at the client side.
This patch handles the filter on the server side.

Change-Id: Idfc4ff39ceed14842878d5b4b874bb9b1c0fc4f3

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-13 00:16:50.000000000', 'message': 'Enable python3 support

Update the charm to run under python3. Currenlty the primary charm,
cinder, which this is a subordinate to is already python3. With the
disparity between subordinate and primary pip packages are missing.

Updating the subordinate to python3 will resolve these issues.

Change-Id: I4b7692743b99f845e750bc59126bee08a69ffe55
'}]
commit_message:
Enable python3 support

Update the charm to run under python3. Currenlty the primary charm,
cinder, which this is a subordinate to is already python3. With the
disparity between subordinate and primary pip packages are missing.

Updating the subordinate to python3 will resolve these issues.

Change-Id: I4b7692743b99f845e750bc59126bee08a69ffe55

messages:
[{'account_id': 20870, 'date': '2019-02-04 16:37:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20870, 'date': '2019-02-04 18:40:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

charm-recheck-full'}, {'account_id': 7730, 'date': '2019-02-05 10:18:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I found some strings that are formatted which need to be changed in test/basic_deployment.py. If you can update them I think we are good.

Thanks Alex.'}, {'account_id': 20870, 'date': '2019-02-06 10:31:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

sahid, please could you highlight the strings you want changed or remove your -1.  thanks.'}, {'account_id': 7730, 'date': '2019-02-06 11:53:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Sure, it's probably something that I should have done with my previous review.

  diff --git a/tests/basic_deployment.py b/tests/basic_deployment.py
  index 29ce31b..48065d2 100644
  --- a/tests/basic_deployment.py
  +++ b/tests/basic_deployment.py
  @@ -745,7 +745,7 @@ class CinderBackupBasicDeployment(OpenStackAmuletDeployment):
		     # NOTE(hopem): it appears that at some point cinder-backup stopped
		     # restoring volume metadata properly so revert to default name if
		     # original is not found
  -            name = "restore_backup_%s" % (vol_backup.id)
  +            name = "restore_backup_{}".format(vol_backup.id)
		     try:
		         cinder_vols = [v for v in vols if v.name == name]
		     except AttributeError:
  @@ -753,11 +753,11 @@ class CinderBackupBasicDeployment(OpenStackAmuletDeployment):
   
	   if not cinder_vols:
		     try:
  -                msg = ("Could not find restore vol '%s' in %s" %
  -                       (name, [v.name for v in vols]))
  +                msg = ("Could not find restore vol '{}' in {}".format(
  +                       name, [v.name for v in vols]))
		     except AttributeError:
  -                msg = ("Could not find restore vol '%s' in %s" %
  -                       (name, [v.display_name for v in vols]))
  +                msg = ("Could not find restore vol '{}' in {}".format(
  +                       name, [v.display_name for v in vols]))
		     u.log.error(msg)
		     amulet.raise_status(amulet.FAIL, msg=msg)
   
  diff --git a/unit_tests/test_utils.py b/unit_tests/test_utils.py
  index 74b57c8..5819155 100644
  --- a/unit_tests/test_utils.py
  +++ b/unit_tests/test_utils.py
  @@ -35,7 +35,7 @@ def load_config():
   
	     if not config:
	   logging.error('Could not find config.yaml in any parent directory '
  -                      'of %s. ' % __file__)
  +                      'of {}. '.format(__file__))
	   raise Exception
   
	     return yaml.safe_load(open(config).read())['options']'}, {'account_id': 20870, 'date': '2019-02-13 16:24:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7730, 'date': '2019-02-13 16:40:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 20805, 'date': '2019-02-13 18:26:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Thank you!'}]

commit_message:
Fix various races with detach_volume

detach_volume causes configuration changes on a compute host depending
on the volume being detached. By definition it modifies the
configuration of the guest on the underlying hypervisor. It may also
make other host-level changes, like unmounting a remote filesystem or
disconnecting from a remote volume. As such, it is not safe for it to
race with other operations which also do those things. This includes
itself, as we currently allow several detaches of the same attachment
concurrently.

Change-Id: Ia6fcb32b48ebec2f89560a59c776f06ed2c665b1
Closes-Bug: #1662483

messages:

This is not quite correct. We need to be able to store both, and we probably should fix the primary key to be (uuid, processed) (gah, how did we miss it??).'}, {'account_id': 21909, 'date': '2019-02-13 17:40:44.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Abandoned in favor of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/636692/'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-13 15:16:00.000000000', 'message': 'For ironic_inspector database, query using node_uuid only when adding entry

When using store_data=database with sqlalchemy, running introspection results
in a DBDuplicateEntry error.  This happens because the query when adding an
entry uses both the primary key (uuid) and the processed flag.  When an entry
is added with processed=false a subsequent query will fail with processed=true
causing a new row to be added with the same primary key (uuid).  The fix is to
query using only uuid.

Change-Id: I5b64053ea5cfa7d2d53886775e038f31fec24c44
Story: #2004992
Task: #29463
'}]
commit_message:
For ironic_inspector database, query using node_uuid only when adding entry

When using store_data=database with sqlalchemy, running introspection results
in a DBDuplicateEntry error.  This happens because the query when adding an
entry uses both the primary key (uuid) and the processed flag.  When an entry
is added with processed=false a subsequent query will fail with processed=true
causing a new row to be added with the same primary key (uuid).  The fix is to
query using only uuid.

Change-Id: I5b64053ea5cfa7d2d53886775e038f31fec24c44
Story: #2004992
Task: #29463

Run functional tests serially

The tests are not written to be run in parallel.
All Quota tests fail itermittenly when run in parallel.

commit_message:
Bump timeout on dsvm jobs

Many time out even when all tests are succeeding and
we will save more resources not having to recheck than by
keeping the timeout where it is.

Change-Id: I2a84e7a1340ccccb79170196b810aeda7d12914d
(cherry picked from commit 1471376131859fcafeb3e88c2058549c5fc24fad)

commit_message:
Add a custom JSONEncoder

A custom JSONEncoder allowing to serialize decimal.Decimal instances
is defined in several places in the codebase. This provides a common
encoder class that supports decimal.Decimal and datetime.datetime objects.

Change-Id: Ie65b1f97f2eeb7a8bc6203576bdbc50b109867cc

commit_message:
Remove duplicated jobs and refactor jobs

This is a follow-up from I96a96a9d6f23f02f9f49c962f183e8c5ca78e048
Removing the duplicated jobs after we have the patches for other
repositories merged.

Also we have refactor the jobs so we can use ironic-base in other
repositories jobs to avoid unnecessary code duplication

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/629494/
Change-Id: Icd4a486f176c8d7dbd78426c39097c169f27c0ae

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-13 14:02:21.000000000', 'message': 'Add link to activity metrics to team pages

We are looking at removing team details from the openstack.org/software
pages, and linking to the team pages on governance.o.o/tc instead.

Add a link to team activity metrics (as displayed by Stackalytics)
to the team pages, so that people can still find that data if they care
about it.

Change-Id: I8fa5cf7e77174b9ddab2e184e839159afcec2ad4
'}]
commit_message:
Add link to activity metrics to team pages

We are looking at removing team details from the openstack.org/software
pages, and linking to the team pages on governance.o.o/tc instead.

Add a link to team activity metrics (as displayed by Stackalytics)
to the team pages, so that people can still find that data if they care
about it.

Change-Id: I8fa5cf7e77174b9ddab2e184e839159afcec2ad4

commit_message:
Replace notification.conf with monasca-notification.conf

notification.conf is the deprecated path for the configuration file.
The new path is /etc/monasca/monasca-notification.conf .

Note: devstack is still using the deprecated configuration file. This
will be change in another changeset (against openstack/monasca-api).

Change-Id: I9ef1d7149308893544ad4d6fef4f3281da676171
Story: 2004862
Task: 29103

commit_message:
[docs] Update FWaaS v2 deployment scenario

The docs currently do not mention that OVS is required for FWaaS v2.
This patch provides a note and links to OVS deployment scenarios.

Closes-Bug: 1781166
Change-Id: I650b42f9a4645ed17fbfe3b5c25da9d23c6a3a52

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-13 11:04:50.000000000', 'message': 'Give super user rights to octavia-deployment-config external_deploy_tasks.

The external_deploy_tasks are invoked from external_upgrade_steps_playbook.yaml
with become: false. For that reason, some file/dir creation, copy, etc... tasks
in external_deploy_tasks will fail unless become: true is set into that specif
task.

Change-Id: Ifa7490ef172d5e9f6bf936a8049111f66b802858
Closes-Bug: #1815745
'}, {'created': '2019-02-13 11:19:05.000000000', 'message': 'Give super user rights to octavia-deployment-config external_deploy_tasks.

The external_deploy_tasks are invoked from deploy_steps_playbook.yaml
with become: false. For that reason, some file/dir creation, copy, etc... tasks
in external_deploy_tasks will fail unless become: true is set into that specific
task.

commit_message:
Give super user rights to octavia-deployment-config external_deploy_tasks.

The external_deploy_tasks are invoked from deploy_steps_playbook.yaml
with become: false. For that reason, some file/dir creation, copy, etc... tasks
in external_deploy_tasks will fail unless become: true is set into that specific
task.

Change-Id: Ifa7490ef172d5e9f6bf936a8049111f66b802858
Closes-Bug: #1815745

commit_message:
Add configurable libvirt firmware

When libvirt boots up a domain in UEFI mode, the system needs
a firmware loader to proceed. Apparently, the location of
the firmware blobs are not standardized across Linux distributions.

With this change, whenever dynamic emulator boots a domain in
UEFI mode, emulator configures libvirt domain to use specific
firmware image. The map of firmware loader locations can
be configured via the configuration file.

Change-Id: I15ff24d8624272c6792cc53dc9a34b69ece480b0

commit_message:
Add ironic-ui integration tests

This patch adds basic tests to verify that ironic-ui is
installed and could be opened.

ironic-ui-integration-tests job is added in a
non-voting mode.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/634712
Change-Id: Ie77be522679c9076ccbfb133eadaae7228adb03c

Change-Id: I79f1554607cd23e6f9eeb4e1973c202835686940
'}]
commit_message:
Set storage_backend to sqlalchemy and version to 1

This is required to unblock CI since Cloudkitty in
Stein has moved to InfluxDB with their storage v2 by
default. We do not deploy InfluxDB yet so we cannot
test this.

Change-Id: I79f1554607cd23e6f9eeb4e1973c202835686940

The smoke test runs tests on the most recent release combination, for a test run on the whole suite you can issue a `charm-recheck-full` through Gerrit comment'}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2018-12-06 03:44:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

This looks like a sensible and valuable change.

The charmhelpers directory in the classic charms is synchronized from a upstream shared library located at https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers

The change must be landed there before we can land it in this and other charms.

Since this change will affect all of our charms, as a part of extra testing you could also exercize the charm-helper-sync scenario test located here: https://github.com/openstack-charmers/openstack-mojo-specs/tree/master/specs/full_stack/next_charmhelper_sync'}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2018-12-06 03:44:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
add driver name when generating database connection

When generating database URL, the driver is not specified. It is
recommended by oslo.db to use for MySQL 'pymysql's driver. For
PostgreSQL nothing clear is recommended.

Change-Id: I9ee8c2dde27b2baa8077ab358468d6112bee7bd3
Closes-Bug: 1805594
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Fix multiple backend test

This patch fixes the secret tests for multiple backends.  The tests
were assuming that there would be at least two configured backends
when multiple backends is enabled.   All these test fail when
testing a deployment that has multiple backends = True but only
one configured backend.

Change-Id: I177096155592e14bfe617dd4b79b1e052de3e8c5

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-06 11:53:15.000000000', 'message': 'Fix SUBNETPOOL_V4_ID check in devstack

In the devstack script, `[ -n $SUBNETPOOL_V4_ID ]` returns true even if
SUBNETPOOL_V4_ID variable is not defined, which is not expected.
I can see the error as the following:

```
2019-02-06 07:20:57.095 | Finalizing Neutron networking for Trove
2019-02-06 07:20:57.095 | Dumping current network parameters:
...
2019-02-06 07:20:57.096 |   SUBNETPOOL_V4_ID:
...
2019-02-06 07:21:02.706 | openstack subnet create: error: argument --subnet-pool: expected one argument
```

This patch changes that to `[ -n "$SUBNETPOOL_V4_ID" ]`

Change-Id: Ib37b2ade3d7cf556340944a56944beb4bb47d7d9
'}, {'created': '2019-02-13 10:13:57.000000000', 'message': 'Fix SUBNETPOOL_V4_ID check in devstack

In the devstack script, `[ -n $SUBNETPOOL_V4_ID ]` returns true even if
SUBNETPOOL_V4_ID variable is not defined, which is not expected.
I can see the error as the following:

```
2019-02-06 07:20:57.095 | Finalizing Neutron networking for Trove
2019-02-06 07:20:57.095 | Dumping current network parameters:
...
2019-02-06 07:20:57.096 |   SUBNETPOOL_V4_ID:
...
2019-02-06 07:21:02.706 | openstack subnet create: error: argument --subnet-pool: expected one argument
```

This patch changes that to `[ -n "$SUBNETPOOL_V4_ID" ]`

Change-Id: Ib37b2ade3d7cf556340944a56944beb4bb47d7d9
'}]
commit_message:
Fix SUBNETPOOL_V4_ID check in devstack

In the devstack script, `[ -n $SUBNETPOOL_V4_ID ]` returns true even if
SUBNETPOOL_V4_ID variable is not defined, which is not expected.
I can see the error as the following:

```
2019-02-06 07:20:57.095 | Finalizing Neutron networking for Trove
2019-02-06 07:20:57.095 | Dumping current network parameters:
...
2019-02-06 07:20:57.096 |   SUBNETPOOL_V4_ID:
...
2019-02-06 07:21:02.706 | openstack subnet create: error: argument --subnet-pool: expected one argument
```

This patch changes that to `[ -n "$SUBNETPOOL_V4_ID" ]`

Change-Id: Ib37b2ade3d7cf556340944a56944beb4bb47d7d9

commit_message:
Add python 3.6 unit test job

This is a mechanically generated patch to add a unit test job running
under Python 3.6 as part of the python3-first goal.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: I7bf0059dc088ac71b7022624765d70f148dd08a1

messages:
[{'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2019-02-07 21:52:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2019-02-08 08:38:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

This patch series plus the puppet-glance change fixes Ubuntu Stein with python3. There are two outstanding issues after that:

- Need to work through enabling SSL for Ubuntu again, I think glance is blocking that right now, need to investigate and talk to ykarel again.

- This patch installs python3-rbd and python3-rados which is required by nova-compute when we use rbd image backend, previously this is installed by something else which I haven't figured out yet. We need to discuss where to place that logic since this change in p-o-i is only to make it passing right now.

The other two changes in repos.pp has been reported to Canonical and will be fixed in the packages, so we can remove those pretty soon."}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-02-09 00:56:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-02-11 15:40:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Install python-keystonemiddleware for Ubuntu

The swift packages does not properly depend on the
python-keystonemiddleware package (py2).

This instead installs this package until the package
dependency is corrected. Swift is still py2 only.

Change-Id: Id2de5a2a99b6f9baa9327a51160c080dd984df85

commit_message:
Install python3-websockify for Ubuntu

The nova-novncproxy package in Ubuntu bionic-updates
Stein repo does not properly depends on python3-websockify
which causes nova-novncproxy service to fail to start.

This installs this package in testing after the repos has
been added until this is fixed in the package by Canonical.

Change-Id: Ic690b7091f1f24ec7a0f3716748edabc7e1d0bf1

commit_message:
Disable SSL for Ubuntu

Ubuntu with python3 has problems with SSL.

I think this is specifically glance causing py3 + ssl
issues that we've seen before.

Setting these to false to see if we can get Ubuntu passing
then fix SSL with python3 with some help from others afterwards.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/635469/
Change-Id: I4d53fc7c890943efe0be3a7707e7af5576a143e7

commit_message:
Make compute rpcapi version calculation check all cells

For top-level services, the compute rpcapi module needs to check for the
minimum version of nova-compute in all cells in order to function
properly during an upgrade. This moves that module to use the all-cells
variant of this routine in the case where [api_database]/connection is
set.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/625039/

Change-Id: Icddbe4760eaff30e4e13c1e8d3d5d3f489dac3c4
Closes-Bug: #1807044
(cherry picked from commit d779b33d72d6ef41651ce7b93fe982f121bae2d7)

commit_message:
Add heat user to heat domain admin role

Currently in rocky, due to the fact we replaced
the ansible keystone plugin, the heat user is
not being added in the heat domain, which causes
issues for example to magnum to create stacks and
nodes. This role is stated in the heat openstack
installation docs.

This patch aims to implemente the role assignment

Depends-On: I2fbb2465f9b4765a87011dfb2c2f65bd27e7b2c9 

Change-Id: Ib65a12990059f8125caff279622d89643bcc2fd5

commit_message:
Use cls.skipException and raise it

skip() has been deprecated from Tempest and the skipException
exception has been introduced. The same changes are reflected here,
along with raising the exceptions which were missed in the previous
patches.

Change-Id: I994eead1bd4e41b50b8180840074f09eb6d6bb55

commit_message:
Make service.get_minimum_version_all_cells() cache the results

This makes the all-cells minimum version helper use a cell-aware cache
in order to avoid doing expensive lookups multiple times. This is a
little more complicated than the regular caching approach, in that we
need to be aware of multiple results for all the cells, as well as
a potential for the list of cells to change over time if we are HUP'd
to reload the list.

Change-Id: I9ee76944860f6f3fb8bcaba1c44c3fe85ac5057b
Related-Bug: #1807044

[{'created': '2019-01-29 15:04:47.000000000', 'message': 'Remove ANSIBLE_ROLE_FETCH_MODE

There was previously an environment variable (``ANSIBLE_ROLE_FETCH_MODE``)
to set whether the roles in ansible-role-requirements.yml were fetched using
ansible-galaxy or using git, however the default has been git for some time
ansible since the use of the ``ceph-ansible`` respoitory for ceph deployment,
using ansible-galaxy to download the roles does not work properly. This
functionality has therefore been removed.

Change-Id: Icf804e40bb4903e45e4357de8c775606087bb5c4
'}]
commit_message:
Remove ANSIBLE_ROLE_FETCH_MODE

There was previously an environment variable (``ANSIBLE_ROLE_FETCH_MODE``)
to set whether the roles in ansible-role-requirements.yml were fetched using
ansible-galaxy or using git, however the default has been git for some time
ansible since the use of the ``ceph-ansible`` respoitory for ceph deployment,
using ansible-galaxy to download the roles does not work properly. This
functionality has therefore been removed.

Change-Id: Icf804e40bb4903e45e4357de8c775606087bb5c4

commit_message:
Notify not only cinder service, but also Apache

Apache needs to be notified as well in case the API is being served in
that context, otherwise config changes would not take effect without
manual intervention.

Change-Id: If5e7c14d59843ee7c813eb1df8d7131e002dbd22

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-21 06:44:36.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Improve port dhcp Provisioning

Currently, the dhcp Provisioning of ports is the crucial bottleneck
of that concurrently boot multiple VM.

The root cause is that these ports will be processed one by one by
dhcp agent when they belong to the same network, And the 'Provisioning
complete' port is still blocked other port's processing in other dhcp
agents.

The patch plan to optimize the dispatch strategy of the port cast to
agent to improve the Provisioning process.

Related-Bug: #1760047
Change-Id: I255caa0571c42fb012fe882259ef181070beccef

"}, {'created': '2018-12-26 03:18:05.000000000', 'message': "Improve port dhcp Provisioning

Currently, the dhcp Provisioning of ports is the crucial bottleneck
of that concurrently boot multiple VM.

The root cause is that these ports will be processed one by one by
dhcp agent when they belong to the same network, And the 'Provisioning
complete' port is still blocked other port's processing in other dhcp
agents. The patch aim to optimize the dispatch strategy of the port cast
to agent to improve the Provisioning process.

In server side, I classify messages to multi levels. Especially, I classify
the port_update_end or port_create_end message to two levels, the high-level
message only cast to one agent, the low-level message cast to all agent. In
agent side I put these messages to `resource_processing_queue`, with the queue,
We can delete `_net_lock` and process these messages in order of priority.

Additonally, I modified the `resource_processing_queue` for my demand.

Related-Bug: #1760047
Change-Id: I255caa0571c42fb012fe882259ef181070beccef
"}, {'created': '2018-12-30 08:23:44.000000000', 'message': "Improve port dhcp Provisioning

Currently, the dhcp Provisioning of ports is the crucial bottleneck
of that concurrently boot multiple VM.

The root cause is that these ports will be processed one by one by
dhcp agent when they belong to the same network, And the 'Provisioning
complete' port is still blocked other port's processing in other dhcp
agents. The patch aim to optimize the dispatch strategy of the port cast
to agent to improve the Provisioning process.

In server side, I classify messages to multi levels. Especially, I classify
the port_update_end or port_create_end message to two levels, the high-level
message only cast to one agent, the low-level message cast to all agent. In
agent side I put these messages to `resource_processing_queue`, with the queue,
We can delete `_net_lock` and process these messages in order of priority.

Additonally, I modified the `resource_processing_queue` for my demand. I update
`_queue` from LIST to PriorityQueue in `ExclusiveResourceProcessor`, by this
way, we can sort all message which cached in `ExclusiveResourceProcessor` by
priority.

Related-Bug: #1760047
Change-Id: I255caa0571c42fb012fe882259ef181070beccef

commit_message:
Improve port dhcp Provisioning

Currently, the dhcp Provisioning of ports is the crucial bottleneck
of that concurrently boot multiple VM.

The root cause is that these ports will be processed one by one by dhcp
agent when they belong to the same network, And the 'Provisioning complete'
port is still blocked other port's processing in other dhcp agents. The
patch aim to optimize the dispatch strategy of the port cast to agent to
improve the Provisioning process.

In server side, I classify messages to multi levels. Especially, I classify
the port_update_end or port_create_end message to two levels, the high-level
message only cast to one agent, the low-level message cast to all agent. In
agent side I put these messages to `resource_processing_queue`, with the queue,
We can delete `_net_lock` and process these messages in order of priority.

Additonally, I modified the `resource_processing_queue` for my demand. I update
`_queue` from LIST to PriorityQueue in `ExclusiveResourceProcessor`, by this
way, we can sort all message which cached in `ExclusiveResourceProcessor` by
priority.

Related-Bug: #1760047
Change-Id: I255caa0571c42fb012fe882259ef181070beccef

subject: Add py36 env
messages:
[{'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2019-02-13 07:13:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-02-13 08:46:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

I am okay with this.


Note that after this both xenial and bionic env will get an exit code 1 when running "tox", but it is done for many projects.

(Personally I always use "tox -e <env>" :p)'}, {'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2019-02-13 09:27:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2019-02-13 11:09:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Add py36 env

While running `tox` command in binoic env, we see the following
message,
ERROR: InterpreterNotFound: python3.5
It is because the default py3 version for binoic is py36.
This patch adds the env in OSC also maintaining consistency
with setup.cfg

Change-Id: I8e5cf72901cba34ad44f2b356609f85b3b0c431f

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-10 23:44:38.000000000', 'message': "More explicitly document driver connection strings

If you're not intimately familiar with RFC 1808 it can be a bit tricky to
write tooz connection strings. In addition, some drivers do not document the
options that they recognize in a connection string. This can force a user to
read the driver code in order to figure out how to configure tooz to use said
driver, which should not be the case.

This change more explicitly documents the format of the connection string,
including which parts of an RFC 1808 URI it recognizes, and the options that
can be passed. It also clarifies which parts of the connection string are
optional (possibly because they have defaults) and which must always be
included.

Note that not every possible configuration is documented. For example, the
postgres driver supports multiple methods of configuring the connection host
and port. For consistency, I only documented the one that matches the other
drivers. This should be sufficient to allow a user to write a working
connection string.

This change also wires the etcd3 and etcd3gw drivers into the doc index since
they were missing before.

Change-Id: I66e54433115f27fb54badc2173f8f6044c49aacb

commit_message:
More explicitly document driver connection strings

If you're not intimately familiar with RFC 1808 it can be a bit tricky to
write tooz connection strings. In addition, some drivers do not document the
options that they recognize in a connection string. This can force a user to
read the driver code in order to figure out how to configure tooz to use said
driver, which should not be the case.

This change more explicitly documents the format of the connection string,
including which parts of an RFC 1808 URI it recognizes, and the options that
can be passed. It also clarifies which parts of the connection string are
optional (possibly because they have defaults) and which must always be
included.

Note that not every possible configuration is documented. For example, the
postgres driver supports multiple methods of configuring the connection host
and port. For consistency, I only documented the one that matches the other
drivers. This should be sufficient to allow a user to write a working
connection string.

This change also wires the etcd3 and etcd3gw drivers into the doc index since
they were missing before.

Change-Id: I66e54433115f27fb54badc2173f8f6044c49aacb

commit_message:
Allow nova to import networking-vsphere's drivers

The spec file shows networking-vsphere supplied nova
drivers cannot be imported by nova compute. This patch
copies the drivers into a directory that is accesslble
from the nova code.

commit_message:
Add integrated tests into gate

In https://review.openstack.org/629544 the tests were added
to the check pipeline, but not the gate pipeline. This ensures
that they're also in the gate pipeline.

Change-Id: I1f557902b79295c109108b6b7c68a282fe7c6205

nlbaas2octavia: do not change SG owned by user

When a user associated a VIP to his own security group, the migration
should not change its ownership.

subject: Normalize endpoint path in oauth client
messages:
[{'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2019-02-12 14:50:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6167, 'date': '2019-02-13 01:26:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)

LGTM, thanks'}, {'account_id': 20190, 'date': '2019-02-13 08:16:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

looks reasonable'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-12 14:50:31.000000000', 'message': 'Normalize endpoint path in oauth client

oauthlib uses the request URI as input for generating an oauth
signature and matching it against the incoming oauth_signature request
attribute. tempest also uses the URI to generate this signature, which
means the URIs must match exactly.

If the keystone catalog contains an endpoint with a trailing slash, such
as https://keystone.example.org/v3/, then the URI that tempest uses for
the signature generation will be
https://keystone.example.org/v3//OS-OAUTH1/request_token. The incoming
request URI that oauthlib sees will not have the duplicate slash and so
the resulting signature will differ, and the auth request will be
rejected due to mismatching HMAC-SHA1 signatures.

This patch corrects the issue for deployments that use a trailing slash
in their keystone catalogs (which is valid) by normalizing the path
before generating the signature.

Change-Id: Ie827b1af7b23c6d6eaf2c2894cc2629d0e252108
'}]
commit_message:
Normalize endpoint path in oauth client

oauthlib uses the request URI as input for generating an oauth
signature and matching it against the incoming oauth_signature request
attribute. tempest also uses the URI to generate this signature, which
means the URIs must match exactly.

If the keystone catalog contains an endpoint with a trailing slash, such
as https://keystone.example.org/v3/, then the URI that tempest uses for
the signature generation will be
https://keystone.example.org/v3//OS-OAUTH1/request_token. The incoming
request URI that oauthlib sees will not have the duplicate slash and so
the resulting signature will differ, and the auth request will be
rejected due to mismatching HMAC-SHA1 signatures.

This patch corrects the issue for deployments that use a trailing slash
in their keystone catalogs (which is valid) by normalizing the path
before generating the signature.

Change-Id: Ie827b1af7b23c6d6eaf2c2894cc2629d0e252108

messages: [{'account_id': 16011, 'date': '2019-02-12 15:22:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2019-02-13 08:19:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2019-02-13 08:19:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Workflow'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2019-02-13 09:22:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-12 15:22:00.000000000', 'message': 'Restart dnsmasq after clearing iptables

During a test run, iptables is cleared and NATs are implemented by dnsmasq.
On subsequent runs, the clearing of iptables blows out the NATs and the
dnsmasq restart handler is not properly triggered. This patch shifts the task
to where the handler can be properly notified.

Change-Id: I4a274e0bfc6b099dc465ee11087977836b66f249
'}]
commit_message:
Restart dnsmasq after clearing iptables

During a test run, iptables is cleared and NATs are implemented by dnsmasq.
On subsequent runs, the clearing of iptables blows out the NATs and the
dnsmasq restart handler is not properly triggered. This patch shifts the task
to where the handler can be properly notified.

Change-Id: I4a274e0bfc6b099dc465ee11087977836b66f249

reference:

example_feature="/srv/magnum/kubernetes/manifests/"
[ -f ${example_feature} ] || {
    echo "Writing File: $example_feature"
    mkdir -p $(dirname ${example_feature})
    cat << EOF > ${example_feature}
---
kind: ConfigMap
apiVersion: v1
metadata:
  name: example-feature-script-cm
  namespace: magnum-tiller
  labels:
    app: helm
data:
  feature-install.sh: |
    #!/bin/bash
    set -e
    set -x
    mkdir -p ${HELM_HOME}
    cp /etc/helm/* ${HELM_HOME}

    helm init -c
    helm install stable/metrics-server
---
apiVersion: batch/v1
kind: Job
metadata:
  name: example-feature-job
  namespace: magnum-tiller
spec:
  backoffLimit: 5
  template:
    spec:
      serviceAccountName: tiller
      containers:
      - name: config-helm
        image: docker.io/openstackmagnum/helm-client:dev
        command:
        - bash
        args:
        - /opt/magnum/feature-install.sh
        env:
        - name: HELM_HOME
          value: /helm_home
        - name: TILLER_NAMESPACE
          value: magnum-tiller
        - name: HELM_TLS_ENABLE
          value: true
        volumeMounts:
        - name: example-feature-script-vol
          mountPath: /opt/magnum/
        - mountPath: /etc/helm
          name: helm-client-certs
      restartPolicy: Never
      volumes:
        - name: example-feature-script-vol
          configMap:
            name: example-feature-script-cm
        - name: helm-client-certs
          secret:
            secretName: helm-client-secret
EOF
}
kubectl apply -f ${example_feature}'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2019-02-06 10:47:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 19.'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2019-02-06 10:53:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 29425, 'date': '2019-02-06 11:00:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 29425, 'date': '2019-02-06 16:08:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 20.'}, {'account_id': 29425, 'date': '2019-02-06 16:15:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 21.'}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2019-02-07 07:17:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 21:

'}, {'created': '2018-10-23 08:15:14.000000000', 'message': 'k8s_fedora: Deploy tiller

Tiller is deployed by default in k8s_fedora_atomic clusters.
Add tiller_tag label to select the version of tiller. If the
tag is not set the tag that matches the helm client version in
the heat-agent will be picked.  The tiller image can be stored
in a private registry and the cluster can pull it using the
container_infra_prefix label.

story: 2003902
task: 26780

Change-Id: I99d3a78085ba10030200f12bbfe58a72964e2326
Signed-off-by: Spyros Trigazis <spyridon.trigazis@cern.ch>

commit_message:
k8s_fedora: Deploy tiller

Add enable_tiller  label to install tiller in k8s_fedora_atomic
clusters. Defaults to false.

Add tiller_tag label to select the version of tiller. If the
tag is not set the tag that matches the helm client version in
the heat-agent will be picked.  The tiller image can be stored
in a private registry and the cluster can pull it using the
container_infra_prefix label.

Install tiller securely using helper container.

TODO:

*add instructions on how RBAC is designed
https://docs.helm.sh/using_helm/#example-deploy-tiller-in-a-namespace-restricted-to-deploying-resources-in-another-namespace
* add docs on how to install addon in the cluster using this tiller
* how users can get the creds to talk to tiller

NOTE:
The main goal of this tiller is internal usage!
Users can still deploy other tillers in other namespaces.

story: 2003902
task: 26780

Change-Id: I99d3a78085ba10030200f12bbfe58a72964e2326
Signed-off-by: dioguerra <dy090.guerra@gmail.com>

subject: Separate opt registration from command running
messages:
[{'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-01-25 13:43:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-01-25 13:45:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Unsure how or if to test these changes, since covering main covers them and the methods do very very little. Suggestions? Comments?'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2019-01-25 19:21:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Yeah, we've still got full coverage of this code with the existing tests since it's just a refactoring. I guess the only thing you might add is a test that does the pre-registration like placement wants to just to make sure that use case doesn't get broken in the future."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-01-28 15:24:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

Straight refactor, no logic change, seems fine. I'm fuzzy on how this helps the consumer of the lib; is there a patch forthcoming to demonstrate that?"}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-01-28 15:28:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > Straight refactor, no logic change, seems fine. I'm fuzzy on how
 > this helps the consumer of the lib; is there a patch forthcoming to
 > demonstrate that?

Yeah, I was gonna do that and then got sucked into other stuff, will create something that depends on this.

to be responsible for parsing the conf (see [1]). Since
registering command line options must come before parsing,

commit_message:
Separate opt registration from command running

In some scenarios, it is useful for the caller of upgradecheck
to be responsible for parsing the conf (see [1]). Since
registering command line options must come before parsing,
we must separate registation from running the commands.

This change enables that by making `register_cli_options` public
and extracting a public `run` method. `main` continues to work
as before by calling these new methods.

[1] I2eea00343d1bbdf486985daeaf6707358b6a2708

Change-Id: I3d7e28d2432f5b04d4154793025786dc289b0cb2

commit_message:
Move displayed checker title to be in variable

Title of check command displayed to user is now moved
to be defined as atribute of UpgradeCommands class.
This will allow to override this command for projects which
inherits from this class.

This will be usefull for Neutron to use same class in new
sanity-check tool which will be implemented in same way as
upgrade-check is done.

Change-Id: I8218b21a219db3a3198750fd98033aff244b7002
Related-Bug: #1809878

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-13 05:22:25.000000000', 'message': 'horizon: add patch to turn off compression for tests

the user running the test does not have read access to the static files
and raises permission errors

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/627741 enabled template.debug
as a result permission denied which were ignored earlier, are now
caught and raised.

this patch is needed to unblock the CI, untill the upstream review is
merged or there is a resolution for this problem

upstream review: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/635159/

Change-Id: Icfb8c1ab237217bb354874691f0ef9ba37bfb681
'}]
commit_message:
horizon: add patch to turn off compression for tests

the user running the test does not have read access to the static files
and raises permission errors

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/627741 enabled template.debug
as a result permission denied which were ignored earlier, are now
caught and raised.

this patch is needed to unblock the CI, untill the upstream review is
merged or there is a resolution for this problem

upstream review: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/635159/

Change-Id: Icfb8c1ab237217bb354874691f0ef9ba37bfb681

commit_message:
Expose is_smartnic in port API

Changes are made to support ironic handling is_smarting port attribute
that was added in this change Ic2ffbd6f1035907ea5a18bda6d2b21e617194195

This change expose is_smartnic port field in REST API, updated API
reference to include is_smartnic field and relevent documentations.

API version updated to 1.53.

Story: #2003346
Change-Id: I89ce54a0c034f2a5f82ff961ab06cfcc6d853bd4

commit_message:
Disable tempest router ping

Tell tempest to skip attempting to ping the router namespace from
localhost because the router namespace is not accessible from localhost
in the os_neutron test scenarios.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/636211
Change-Id: I20a19fd614c1d67b19bd7396b8c48e6667668fbd

commit_message:
watcher: Use python-PrettyTable instead of the py2 name

This is needed on SLES where python-PrettyTable does not provide
python2-PrettyTable.

Change-Id: I6c72ae6ed077db776df37fcd644cfbfd329cf5d9

commit_message:
Allow any scenario to use different container tech

This patch ensures that each scenario's implementation
is independent of the container technology used, so we
can implement tests for each scenario using different
container technologies, or without containers.

The playbook playbooks/containers-deploy.yml is adjusted
to just execute the lxc-related playbooks. Due to the
inventory having no containers, the groups targeted by
the playbooks will be empty, resulting in a skip.

Change-Id: I22b5e4e415fae25590ab7d0ec085c3123059ea29

commit_message:
Execute helm tests in osh-infra single node jobs

This executes the helm tests for the single node jobs in
openstack-helm-infra for rabbitmq, elasticsearch, fluent-logging,
prometheus, and grafana.

Change-Id: I0109cfbe6adeb9e24d513c8313d964323634b8da

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-28 13:30:33.000000000', 'message': "Move openstack_release to seperate file

By moving openstack_release to a seperate file, we're able to run
the documentation jobs only which means that we can make the version
bump patches much easier and smoother.

commit_message:
Use PBR to determine current OpenStack version

Instead of manually bumping openstack_relase, we can use PBR to let
it determine it based on the tags.  This will avoid one bump patch
that we always have to do.

Change-Id: I1deb9588204763e2d98c41eea382fc2eb71afe2c

commit_message:
Switch python3 test to bionic and add it to gate

Ubuntu bionic is python3 by default, and OSA
stein will not support Ubuntu xenial, so it
makes sense to switch the testing to use bionic
instead.

The test is also passing, so we should add it
into the gate queue to prevent regressions.

Change-Id: I43b6aac57f664e19f2d77be5a17fd3cb663075b2

commit_message:
Unit tests: Avoid deprecation warning for getargspec()

inspect.getargspec() is deprecated in Python 3, but there is no equivalent
of inspect.signature() in Python 2.

Change-Id: I4793ac625c1b87e783718bfabe661ccc2ad5dcfd

Thanks for checking, Riccardo!'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2019-02-07 16:30:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 11292, 'date': '2019-02-07 16:48:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2019-02-08 09:29:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2019-02-11 15:40:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Thanks Arne! Not sure if this is -1 or +1. Went with -1. And maybe I am wrong...

Doesn't this change our existing behaviour with IPA? I was wondering whether we could break someone that is using existing IPA. I'd like a bug/story to track this, and a release note.

Am almost wondering whether we should have an option for this."}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2019-02-11 15:51:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Given that the current behavior is more or less random, I'm fine with changing it to something a bit less random (well, names are semi-random still..)"}, {'account_id': 11292, 'date': '2019-02-11 16:59:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 11292, 'date': '2019-02-11 17:07:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)

Thanks for reviewing, Ruby!

I added a story board to explain the background for this change and to keep track of things.
I also added a release note.

Given that the current behaviour is non-deterministic (beyond ordering by size) and that root device hints are still respected, we should not be a breaking someone's deployment.

As for your thought on having an option: root device hints already give full control, this change just reorders something that was not necessarily ordered before (and I believe increases chances that people will not even need root device hints). An option may give the wrong impression of control (as device names may be random as well, as Dmitry pointed out)."}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2019-02-12 09:59:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2019-02-12 16:00:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11076, 'date': '2019-02-13 06:35:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Thank you Arne.'}]

commit_message:
Add secondary sorting by name when guessing root disk

As some BIOSes try to boot only from the "first" disk, Ironic
should order potential disks not only by size, but also by name.
This patch proposes to add secondary sorting by device name when
identifying the root disk.

Change-Id: I4017c839eeb9d00d2b4ad5b90e4e9b65b74296c7
Story: #2004976
Task: #29434
